result.execSummary:
The defendant Tavagus V Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation with no new arrests.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim, A.A.T. (person, property, residence or family).  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

Ct 1: 948.07(6)-Child Enticement-Give/Sell Drugs; Ct 2: 948.40(1)-Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, AAT, (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  Defendant is on house arrest with the exceptions of  going to court and meeting with attorney.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.  AMENDED 01/23/15   GPS MAY BE REMOVED.  DEFENDANT TO ATTEND SCHOOL EACH SCHEDULED DAY.  MUST COMPLETE COURSE WORK; CAUSE NO DISRUPTIONS IN THE CLASSROOM OR HALLWAYS.  ABSENCES WILL ONLY BE EXCUSED WITH A DOCTOR'S EXCUSE

DEFENDANT HELD WITHOUT BOND - ORDERED INTO COMPETENCY RESTORATION PROGRAM
Review hearing at 09-23-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Tavagus V Williams in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for Robert S Repischak for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Maggie Techert.
The Court is in receipt of multiple documents; June and July report from WFU and a letter dated 9/16 from Dr. Lundbohm. The State has had time to review the 9/16 letter from Dr. Lundbohm. Defense has received all and has discussed them with the defendant.
Defense indicates that they wish to have an evidentiary hearing on the matter. Defendant's father makes a statement to the Court regarding placement. The State in dicates that along with the issues of living quarters, the defendant has not complied with the treatment team by giving contradictory statements and numerous missed appointments.

BTC: Defendant taken into custody and ordered into competency restoration program at a State institution.  RH to be set  Review hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
